rooms.name: Gate of Anduin
rooms.description: A huge wall seems to perch on the side of a tall outcropping of rock, and here, huge gates made of stone lead into the city built into it. To the north, a great road leads away from the city, but to the south, a steadily winding road is visible, leading up into the city.

North.description: You see the Great Road leading out into the swamps.

South.description: You see the road that leads through the city.

rooms.name: Inside the Gate of Anduin
rooms.description: Inside the vast stone gates, the fringe of the city of Anduin is visible. The road is paved and well-fitted, leading toward a spiraling path that leads upwards toward the second level of the city. Stout, well-built buildings to the east and west have the mark of the Anduin Guard on them. The gates are visible to the north.

East.description: A stout door leads into the Eastern Barracks.

West.description: A stout door leads into the Western Barracks.

rooms.name: The Eastern Guard Barracks
rooms.description: In here the guards rest from their duties, only a moment away from the city gate. You can see many cots and footlockers, showing how well this city is protected.

East.description: Looking toward the east, you can see a discoloration in the wall.

West.description: A stout door leads outside.

rooms.name: The Western Guard Barracks
rooms.description: In here the guards rest from their duties, only a moment away from the city gate. You can see many cots and footlockers, showing how well this city is protected.

East.description: A door leads outside.

rooms.name: Guard's Secret Exit
rooms.description: This room is obviously well hidden and protected. To the west lies a door with a peep hole. Looking through it you can see a guard's barracks. To the east, lies a stone door that has all kind of strange locks on it and another peep hole. Looking out the peep hole to the east, you can see the swamp stretching before you. This is obviously a back door for the guards.

West.description: Looking west, you see the back of a secret door.  A peephole allows you to look in the room.

extras.text: Looking through the peephole, you can barely see the next room.  Something is partially covering the peephole.

rooms.name: Main Street
rooms.description: This sloping path spirals upwards toward the main part of the city, visible far above, carved right into the rock of the outcropping. Various homes and shops stand near the spiral, but it's rather sparsely built near the city's periphery. Downward lie the gates of Anduin.

rooms.name: Main Street
rooms.description: This sloping path spirals upwards from the main gates of the city toward the city itself, far above. It is rather sparsely built here, but further up there are many buildings visible.

rooms.name: Main Street
rooms.description: This sloping path circles a large reddish-brown outcropping that rises far above the ground. The path is finely hewn of living rock, and twists past a few stone buildings set into the outcropping. The main gates of the city lie below, and the main part of the city is far above here.

rooms.name: Main Street
rooms.description: This sloping path winds up the side of a large outcropping toward what is clearly a city built directly of the rock itself. A few houses and shops stand off the street, but the main part of the city is clearly far above here.

rooms.name: Main Street
rooms.description: This winding path spirals up the side of a large outcropping of rock toward what is clearly a city of some sophistication and size. Houses and shops are cut right out of the living rock, but buildings are rather sparse here, for there isn't much room. Far below, the city's gates are visible.

rooms.name: Main Street
rooms.description: This winding path spirals up the side of a large outcropping of rock toward the dwarven city above. Though there are some houses and shops along the street here, there isn't enough room to have many. The city's gates lie far below, along the rock-carved street.

rooms.name: Main Street
rooms.description: This narrow street is carved right out of the living rock of the outcropping it traverses. Finely hewn and smoothed meticulously, the path goes past a few houses and shops toward a city visible further up. The city's gates lie far below.

rooms.name: Main Street
rooms.description: This busy street winds right up the side of a large rock outcropping. Finely hewn right out of the living rock, it is lined on either side by houses and shops, all cut from rock as well, and all fairly small, reflecting the size of their owners. The street is quite tidy, and leads upward toward the main part of the city, and downward toward the city's gates.

rooms.name: Main Street
rooms.description: This sloping street winds along the side of a large outcropping of rock. It is carved right from the rock itself, well-hewn and polished, and surrounded by various buildings that are also hewn from the rock. Far below, on the twisting street, the city gates stand guarded by dwarven warriors, but the street ends to the north at a large plaza.

rooms.name: The Middle Level of the City of Anduin
rooms.description: Here is the middle level of the city of Anduin, far above the city gates, where the main part of the citizenry lives and works.  The poor sector, grimy and crude, stretches off to the east, with the Dwarven Sector, famous for its metalworking, to the west.  The street continues to spiral upwards and downwards, with the various temples on the upper level, and the city gates far below.

East.description: Looking east, you see Anduin's Poor Sector. Beggar's Way winds through it.

South.description: Looking south, you can see the Main Road of Anduin spiraling down toward the city gates.

West.description: Looking west, you see the Dwarven Sector of Anduin, but for some reason, the gates are closed.

extras.text: The gates are sealed and, when you look closely, you see that there are slits that have dwarven eyes peering suspiciously out. You wonder what could have happened for the dwarves to seal themselves in like that.

rooms.name: Beggar's Way
rooms.description: This is the main street through the poor section of Anduin.  The ground looks like it was just hacked out of the mountain itself, which it probably was.  It is filthy, with refuse and broken bottles everywhere.  Everywhere there is the noise of too many people crowded together, with singing, arguments, and general buzzing voices always audible. A guard barracks lies northward.

North.description: Looking north, you see the Guards Barracks for the Poor Sector of Anduin.

East.description: Looking east, you see Beggar's Way continues.

West.description: Looking west, you see the entrance to the first level of Anduin.

rooms.name: Beggar's Way
rooms.description: This is the main street through Anduin's poor sector. The road looks like it was just hacked out of the mountain's stone, which it probably was, but it can barely be seen through all the litter, broken glass, and general dirt that cover the ground. An alley runs to the south, but Beggar's Way extends to the east and west.

East.description: Looking east, you can see that Beggar's Way continues.

South.description: Looking south you can see an alleyway.

West.description: Looking south, you can see Beggar's Way leading out of the Poor Sector.

rooms.name: Beggar's Way
rooms.description: This is the main street through Anduin's poor sector. It is heavily travelled, and since it runs straight to the east and west, traffic is generally well-behaved. Guards are not as numerous here as in other parts of Anduin, and the area has a generally mean feel to it. Foul food smells emanate from the restaurant to the south.

East.description: Looking east, you can see Beggar's Way continues.

South.description: Looking south and taking a wiff, you can see what can only be Shingle's Soup Kitchen.

West.description: Looking west, you can see Beggar's Way continues.

rooms.name: Beggar's Way
rooms.description: This is the main street through the poor section of Anduin. The ground is littered with dirt, refuse, and broken glass, and the traffic surges through the straight street. The noise is quite bad, and the smell is worse. An alley begins here and runs off to the north.

North.description: Looking north, you see an alleyway. You hear the sounds of laughter.

East.description: Looking east, you can see Beggar's Way continues.

West.description: Looking west, you can see Beggar's Way continues.

rooms.name: Beggar's Way
rooms.description: This is the main street through the poor sector of Anduin, and it is both dirty and crowded. It runs straight from east to west, with a few side alleys and shops along it. The crowd here isn't very pleasant in appearance or in odor. A store stands to the north.

North.description: Looking north, you can see Falstin's Grocery.

East.description: Looking east, you can see Beggar's Way continues.

West.description: Looking west, you can see Beggar's Way continues.

rooms.name: Beggar's Way
rooms.description: This is the main street through Anduin's poor sector. It certainly lives up to its name -- the stone road is unpaved, just hewn right out of the mountain, and it is littered with refuse. The crowd is fairly heavy at all hours, day or night. The Ole Witch Tavern, popular in this part of town, lies to the south.

East.description: Looking east, you can see Beggar's Way continues.

South.description: Looking south you can see the Ole Witch Tavern.

West.description: Looking west, you can see Beggar's Way continues.

rooms.name: Beggar's Way
rooms.description: This is the main street through Anduin's poor sector. The ground, hewn straight from the rock and otherwise unpaved, is littered with general dirt and refuse, and the brisk traffic through here is very bad-smelling and poorly-dressed. Trader's Street lies northward, and Beggar's Way ends to the east.

North.description: Looking north, you can see Trader's Street.

East.description: Looking east, you can see Beggar's Way continues.  The Red Feathered Nest is in the distance.

West.description: Looking west, you can see Beggar's Way continues.

rooms.name: The End of Beggar's Way
rooms.description: This is the end of the main street through Anduin's poor sector. The ground is littered with refuse, particularly with broken bottles from the tavern to the east. The people around here dress in bright clothes, but they are clearly the poorest denizens of the area. A shop stands to the north, an alley to the south, and the tavern to the east.

rooms.name: A Dark Alley
rooms.description: This dark alley is narrow and squalid, with refuse making the way through it a veritable maze. Though voices and activity can be heard to the north, there is little of interest here. Beggar's Way lies northward.

North.description: To the north, you can see Beggar's Way.

South.description: The dark alleyway stretches off to the south.

extras.text: Is that something moving over there?

rooms.name: A Dark Alley
rooms.description: This dark alley is filthy and narrow, with cramped buildings standing on either side of it. There is little of note here among the piles of refuse and squalor, and very few people present, besides drunks muttering to themselves where they lay.

North.description: The dark alleyway stretches off to the north.

South.description: The dark alleyway stretches off to the south.

extras.text: Is that something moving over there?

rooms.name: A Dark Alley
rooms.description: This narrow little alley runs from north to south past squalid buildings and abandoned warehouses, like the one to the east. It is filthy, obviously where the nearby citizens of Anduin toss their garbage and come for secrecy.

North.description: The dark alleyway stretches off to the south.

East.description: Looking to the east, you can see the remains of an old warehouse.

South.description: The dark alleyway stretches off to the south.

extras.text: Is that something moving over there?
The warehouse is old and falling apart.  Many of the windows are missing as are large portions of the roof.  A door lies open before you.

rooms.name: A Dark Alley
rooms.description: The narrow, dark alley runs from here to the north a distance, with an offshoot heading east.  It is filthy from neglect, more than from garbage, and there is nothing of note here.  Tall buildings with unidentifiable purposes stand everywhere, forming the borders of the choked alleyway.

North.description: The dark alleyway stretches off to the north .

East.description: Its too dark to see anything but you think you hear a noise.

extras.text: Is that something moving over there?

rooms.name: A Dead End
rooms.description: The squalid little alley comes to a dead end here, boxed in among cramped, dirty little buildings.  There is a fence to the south which may be openable, but it is rather rusted and seems to be hiding something.

extras.text: You hear a noise, like a knife being drawn from its sheath.
Is that something moving over there?

rooms.name: An Old Warehouse
rooms.description: It's an old warehouse, made out of rotting wood. It is very large, but clearly has not been used in many years. Light peeks in through the gaps in the wooden planks, barely illumining broken crates and barrels strewn around the floor. Boards lie on the floor, and spiderwebs cover everything. Little scurrying sounds can sometimes be heard.

West.description: An dark alleyway lies to the west.

extras.text: This is an old crate, the wood broken and rotted. What's left of its contents is strewn about on the floor with rat droppings in it.

rooms.name: Trader's Street
rooms.description: This relatively clean street runs north-south through a fairly clean part of the poor sector. The traffic is fairly brisk thrugh here, since it joins the popular Pawn Shop to the north with Beggar's Way and the Red Feathered Nest Inn to the south.

rooms.name: Trader's Street
rooms.description: This relatively clean street branches off of Beggar's Way, past very reputable shops and homes carved out of stone. The people passing by are slightly better dressed, though by no means savory, and there are few guards around.

East.description: A door leads into the hovel.

rooms.name: Trader's Street
rooms.description: This relatively clean side street starts here and runs southward a short distance, past fairly reputable shops and homes. The moderate traffic generally heads to the pawnshop to the east, or else to Beggar's Way further south.

rooms.name: A Poor Hovel
rooms.description: This untidy hovel is strewn with clothes and old bits of food and broken crockery. A few pallets are tossed in one corner, but other than that, there is no furniture and nothing of interest.

West.description: A door leads back outside.

rooms.name: The Pawn Shop
rooms.description: This dark, dank little shop is, like most of the buildings in Anduin, carved out of stone. The one or two shelves standing along the walls are stocked with a few goods, but the shop itself seems a bit empty. The only visible exit lies westward.

West.description: Looking west, you can see Trader's Street.

Down.description: Looking down, you see a trapdoor.

rooms.name: The Rope Room
rooms.description: This room is a very plain room.  In the center of the room lies a trapdoor with a length of rope lying next to it.  As you ease the trapdoor open, you are amazed how silent the door is.  Looking down, you see the grass that lies outside of the city.  The rope falls down to the grass below, making a convenient exit outside the city.

Up.description: Looking up you can see the underside of the trapdoor.

Down.description: Looking down the rope, you can see the Great Road just outside the city gates. This looks like a safe way to get out of the city.

extras.text: The rope is very thick and extends down through a trapdoor in the floor. The rope has many knots to ease your climb down.

rooms.name: Bungle's Leather Goods
rooms.description: This shop reeks of leatherworking chemicals, but it's fairly neat. Windows let light in to illumine shelves full of leather goods, folded and labelled for purchase. The only exit lies to the south.

South.description: To the south, you can see Beggar's Way and hear the sounds of people having a good time at the Red Feathered Nest.

rooms.name: The Ole Witch Tavern
rooms.description: This bar is small and intimate, almost crowded, with a crowd of regulars steadily making their way to the bar, where drinks are served. Tables and chairs, most of them old and spotted with beerstains, stand around for use. The one exit lies northward.

North.description: Looking north, you can see Beggar's Way.

rooms.name: Falstin's Grocery
rooms.description: This tidy shop is clean to the point of fastidiousness, with whitewashed walls and a cleanly swept tiled floor. The shelves in the walls are stocked with everything the adventurer needs. The only exit lies to the south.

South.description: Looking south, you can see Beggar's Way.

rooms.name: An Alley
rooms.description: This narrow little alley always seems plunged into perpetual darkness because of the tall buildings standing on either side of it casting long shadows. A few people walk along the alley, but they are in general very low-class-looking people, and anybody here has to take special care not to step on the many pieces of debris and refuse scattered along the alley. The alley opens up into Beggar's Way to the south.

rooms.name: An Alley
rooms.description: This dark alley is filthy, and smells horrible, thanks to the huge piles of litter washed up along the sides of the alley. It is always dark because of the shadows of the buildings alongside it. A few drunks lie around mumbling to themselves, and a few unsavory sorts travel through the alley.

rooms.name: An Alley
rooms.description: This narrow, squalid alley is quite dark from the perpetual shadows cast by the buildings on either side of it. The stench is horrible, and seems to be coming from the huge piles of refuse piled up along the alley's sides. Bloodstains can be seen on the walls from time to time. A bar is visible to the west. The alley extends to the north and south.

rooms.name: An Alley
rooms.description: This is the northern end of a narrow, squalid little alley. The light is very poor at all hours of the day and night, and all the refuse piled up along its sides smell horrible. There is almost no foot traffic through here, possibly because it's almost impossible to pick one's way through the rubble. A warehouse stands to the east.

rooms.name: An Old Warehouse
rooms.description: This old warehouse looks like it hasn't been used in years. Huge white spiderwebs grace the corners of all the walls, and dust is thick on the ground and on the unidentifiable bits of furniture and crates. Nothing of worth appears left here.

Down.description: Looking down, you see that one of the crates has some scratches near it.

extras.text: This is an old crate, the wood broken and rotted. What's left of its contents is strewn about on the floor with rat droppings in it. It looks like there might be a trapdoor under the crate.
Moving a crate, you find a trapdoor. Looking at the trapdoor, you get a sense of evil, as if evil had taken a physical form and became this door.

rooms.name: Phillip's Backdoor Bar
rooms.description: This smoke-filled bar looks like it's been around for many years. It is filled with the lower-class denizens of Anduin -- beggars, drunks, and worse. The smell of cheap beer and bad food mingle with the less savory odors of the patrons, and beaten-up wooden furniture stands atop the old rushes lining the floor. The one exit stands to the east.

extras.text: This is what looks like the remains of a table and several chairs. It looks as if an elephant sat on them.

rooms.name: Shingle's Soup Kitchen
rooms.description: This crowded little diner smells positively disgusting, and it isn't terribly clean. A small bar runs around the kitchen area, and people sit there, eating a strange chili-like stew off of plates or rolls. Occasionally someone gets up and lurches to a latrine conveniently located in the back of the diner. The only other door leads outside to the north. There is a menu on the wall.

North.description: Looking north, you can see Beggar's Way.

extras.text: Welcome to Shingle's Soup Kitchen! Today's Specials Are: SOS on a Plate ...................... 25 coins SOS on a Roll  ...................... 15 coins SOS on a Shingle .................... 1 coin

rooms.name: An Alley
rooms.description: This alley runs north-south through tenements and hovels, all of them filthy and in bad need of repair. The street itself is bare stone, hewn from the mountain, but it can barely be seen through all the litter and refuse on the ground. Beggar's Way lies to the north.

North.description: Looking north, you can see Beggar's Way.

South.description: Looking south, you can see the alleyway continues.

rooms.name: An Alley
rooms.description: This is a alley off Beggar's Way. Drunks lie in the corners amongst the refuse. To the west lies a poor hovel. The alley continues to the south.

North.description: Looking north, you see the alleyway continues.

South.description: Looking south, you see the alleyway continues.

West.description: A door leads into a primitive, ramshackle hovel.

rooms.name: An Alley
rooms.description: This is a alley off Beggar's Way. Drunks lie in the corners amongst the refuse. To the east is a warehouse.

North.description: Looking north, you see the alleyway continues.

East.description: Looking east, you see an old warehouse.

rooms.name: An Old Warehouse
rooms.description: This is an old warehouse. Broken crates and barrels are strewn about the place, but nothing of worth can be seen. Rats scurry about in the shadows.

West.description: Looking west, you can see an alleyway.

rooms.name: A Poor Hovel
rooms.description: This filthy hovel is small and squalid, with refuse and dirty clothes all over the place. It looks like four different people make use of it. A few pallets lie in one corner, and that is all the furniture visible. The only exit lies to the east.

East.description: A door leads outside.

rooms.name: The Guard Barracks
rooms.description: This barracks is made of stone, like all the other buildings in the city, but it has a slightly unkempt look to it. The floor's rushes look a bit too well-used; the walls all bear a slight coating of soot. The air smells of poorly cooked food, and the windows are all closed, so there is little light besides the one lantern dangling from the ceiling. The main door lies to the south, but a barred door stands to the north.

South.description: Looking south, you see Beggar's Way.

rooms.name: A Filthy Cell
rooms.description: This jail cell smells absolutely foul, and looks much worse, with soiled rushes on the dank floor and a few dead rats in the corner, one half-eaten. Chains dangle from the wall.

South.description: The only door is here.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Red Feathered Nest
rooms.description: The crowd is joyous and loud, with brightly-dressed patrons all heading in all directions toward the various entertainments for sale.  The tavern is huge, with a high ceiling and brightly painted walls.  A thick red carpet covers the floor.  To the north is the entrance to the sketchiest union in Caelia: the Bard Union.

extras.text: The room is rather packed tonight. You can see a set of stairs going up to the private rooms and a casino just to the south of the bar.

You see a colorful man before you. He is dressed in silks of from many parts of the world and is seemingly a pleasant man. But as you watch him, you can see him give an experienced look at you from the corner of his eye, as if sizing you up. I'm sure he's just looking to see if you're going to cause trouble. Or is he.. The Colorful Man is in  excellent condition.

rooms.name: The Bar of the Red Feathered Nest
rooms.description: You now stand in the bar area of the Red Feathered Nest.  To the south you can see a casino where people are gambling.  Just to the right of the bar, you can see the bartenders going up and down a stairs into a storeroom that must be just below the bar.  As you watch, occasionally you can see someone dressed in normal street clothes sneak down there.  There must be something extra special going on down there.

extras.text: The bar here is quite busy tonight. People of all races and sizes are pushing their way up to the bar. There is a sign above the bar.
Welcome to the Red Feathered Nest! House Rules ================= 1) No Fighting 2) No Spitting 3) If you aren't drinking, get out and make room for someone that is

rooms.name: The Casino in the Red Feathered Nest
rooms.description: The hubbub in this large, high-ceilinged room is enormous, and the visible people are brightly dressed and uniformly gleeful as they whirl around the various gaming tables. The only visible exit is the archway to the north.

rooms.name: The Upper Halls of the Red Feathered Nest
rooms.description: This hallway begins here and runs to the north a short distance, past doorways set into the east and west walls. Thick, dark blue carpeting muffles most footsteps, and even the noise from the tavern below is muted.

East.description: A door leads into the room.

West.description: A door leads into the room.

rooms.name: The Upper Halls of the Red Feathered Nest
rooms.description: This wide hallway runs from north to south, past doorways leading into bedrooms. Some of the doors are closed, but some are open, indicating vacancy. The receptionist's desk stands to the north.

East.description: A door leads into the room.

West.description: A door leads into the room.

rooms.name: The Red Feathered Nest Reception Lobby
rooms.description: Past all the bedrooms, the receptionist's desk is tastefully carved in rich oakwood. The dark blue carpet on the floor muffles most footsteps, so those in the bedrooms can sleep.

rooms.name: A Bedroom
rooms.description: This is a comfortably furnished bedroom. Though it is small, it has all the amenities one could desire, and even a window in one wall to let in light. Lamps shine from their wall sconces, revealing how nice and clean this room is.

East.description: A door leads out into the hall.

rooms.name: A Bedroom
rooms.description: This is a comfortably furnished bedroom. Though it is small, it has all the amenities one could desire, and even a window in one wall to let in light. Lamps shine from their wall sconces, revealing how nice and clean this room is.

East.description: A door leads to the hallway.

rooms.name: A Bedroom
rooms.description: This is a comfortably furnished bedroom. Though it is small, it has all the amenities one could desire, and even a window in one wall to let in light. Lamps shine from their wall sconces, revealing how nice and clean this room is.

West.description: A door leads back into the hall.

rooms.name: A Bedroom
rooms.description: This is a comfortably furnished bedroom. Though it is small, it has all the amenities one could desire, and even a window in one wall to let in light. Lamps shine from their wall sconces, revealing how nice and clean this room is.

West.description: A door leads outside.

rooms.name: The Storeroom in the Red Feathered Nest
rooms.description: You have entered the storeroom of the Red Feathered Nest.  About you lie beer casks, crates of food, cages of chickens and other small livestock and other things needed to run a Bar and Tavern.

extras.text: You see a large cask of filled with beer. But something about it is strange. The other casks have water droplets forming on them, this one doesn't.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Thieves' Guild
rooms.description: You have found the entrance to the Thieves Guild.  To the east, you can hear the sounds of people talking in a low whisper.  To the west, you can see the back of a cask, perhaps a doorway out of this place.

rooms.name: The Thieves Guild
rooms.description: You are in the Thieves Guild.  To the north, you can see the Thieves Guild Shop which leads to the Thieves Training Grounds.  To the west lies the entrance to the Thieves Guild.  To the south lies the Thieves Exit.

rooms.name: The Thieves Exit
rooms.description: This sparse part of the compound is home only to a trapdoor that has obviously seen much use.

Down.description: A trapdoor is set into the stone floor.

extras.text: The rope is heavy, but very worn from a lot of use.  It is knotted to ease your climb down.

rooms.name: Thieves Shop Master
rooms.description: Here along the wall sits a table with the various implements that an enterprising thief might need in his or her capacity. To the north of here lies the Thieves Training Grounds.

rooms.name: Thieves Training Grounds
rooms.description: You have entered the Thieves Training Grounds. All about you lie various items to help a thief learn his trade; dummies with razor blades about their purses, cages that will keep a thief still for hours at a time, etc.

rooms.name: The Anduin Apothacary
rooms.description: This dry, dimly lit shop is packed to the rafters with ungents and tinctures of all manner.  Bundles of dried herbs hang from the ceiling beams, sorted by family and purpose.  Although the quality of the goods seems quite high and carefully organized, you note nothing is labeled or explained.  It would be easy to overlook some small but critical detail hidden among the various herbs and essences.

rooms.name: A Hidden Staircase
rooms.description: An almost palpable feel of evil permeates this simple staircase. Cut out of stone, it heads downward toward a large room. The stone is painted black, and there is no light source.

Up.description: Looking up, you see the underside of a trapdoor.

Down.description: Looking down, you see a set of stairs spiraling downward into the darkness.

extras.text: The marble walls seem to suck up the light from your lantern. The red streaks in the marble DO look like blood and on closer examination, there are dried spots on the wall.
This can only be dried blood. Bits and pieces of hair and bone fragments are clotted into the spot. Something died very violently here.

rooms.name: A Hidden Staircase
rooms.description: This staircase is carved of dark stone, and is undecorated. There are no external light sources here. An archway leads to the south, and there are carvings over the arch. There is an almost palpable aura of evil about this place.

South.description: Looking south, you see an archway made with some sort of strange workmanship. The passagway beyond curves downward.

extras.text: The archway is carved with a strange style... not quite dwarven but the workmanship is exquisite, assuming you like bones and skull decor. But wait a second.. those don't look quite like stone...

Upon closer examinationon the archway's construction, you can see that the bones and skulls aren't carved, but REAL! The bones are from dwarves, elves, humans and even some from creatures that you don't even recognize. It looks as if the red light is holding them together to form this arch.
Red carvings on a black field read: "Welcome to the Temple of Blackmourne. Enter and pay homage."

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Temple of Blackmourne
rooms.description: This large entranceway is carved out of dark stone, with a red carpet on the floor to muffle footsteps. A low chanting emanates from the temple to the south, resonating through the high ceiling of this chamber. A tapestry depicting one of the symbols of Blackmourne, the four-fingered hand crushing the world, hangs over the archway to the south. A staircase stands to the north.

South.description: As you look to the south, you can see the passageways of the Temple stretch before you.

extras.text: The statue is forged from a strange metal, the like you've never seen before. It is blackish and has a strange shine to it. The skeleton itself is that of a warrior, judging from its build, whoever it was must have been huge in life. Its four fingers are wrapped around an ancient sword.
This sword dates back at least 300 years, to the time of the Rift Wars. The workmanship on the blade is the best you have even seen.

rooms.name: The Foyer Of Blackmourne's Temple
rooms.description: This is the inner foyer of a large temple. The black stone walls are adorned with tapestries, and the stone floor is covered in a blood-red carpet that muffles footsteps. The ceiling is quite high, and it, too, is painted black. Hallways extend to the east and west, and the main part of the temple lies southward.

East.description: The hallway extends in this direction.

South.description: When you look to the south, you can see the Temple before you. You can hear chanting coming from here.

West.description: The hallway extends in this direction.

rooms.name: Blackmourne's Temple
rooms.description: This spacious temple has black stone walls and a blood-red carpet on the floor. Tapestries bordered in runes adorn the walls, each one depicting thousands of people being sacrificed to Blackmourne, depicted as a humanoid figure swathed in black robes. The main altar stands to the south, and the foyer to the north

South.description: Looking south, you can see an altar and some figures.

rooms.name: Before the Sacrifical Altar
rooms.description: Strange black stone walls define the bounds of this dark temple. The ringing of chanting voices always lies in the background, and priests come here to pray incessantly. The altar stands to the south.

South.description: Looking south, you can see the sacrifical altar of Blackmourne.

rooms.name: At the Sacrificial Altar of Blackmourne
rooms.description: A small, intimate chamber, this stone room is painted black, and has a blood-red carpet on the floor. The altar is made of stone as well -- a strange black marble streaked with red and white. The altar is carved with runes, the same ones that adorn the edges of the tapestries that adorn the walls. The one exit stands to the north.

extras.text: The altar that stands before you has a groove cut down the center that leads to a spigot, underneath which can be placed a bucket or container. The groove is stained in blood. The altar itself is made of a strange metal, the carvings look too realistic to have been carved by hand. This altar has an evil aura about it, as if it was alive.
There is a small crack between the altar and the floor. Maybe the altar can be moved to reveal what is underneath.

rooms.name: Priests Hall
rooms.description: This long hallway runs from east to west. Carved out of stone, the walls are painted black, with a blood-red carpet on the floor. Various tapestries hang from the walls, most of them depicting symbols of Blackmourne and weird, otherworldly creatures.

East.description: The hallway continues in this direction.

rooms.name: Priests Hall
rooms.description: This long hallway feels somewhat dank, but the effect is allayed somewhat by the tapestries hanging here and there. The stone is painted black, with a blood-red carpet. A door stands to the east, and a chamber of some kind to the south.

East.description: There is a door with strange runes standing before you.

South.description: You can see a chamber in this direction.

West.description: The hallway extends in this direction.

rooms.name: High Priest of Blackmourne's Study
rooms.description: This large study has black-painted stone walls.  The one large teakwood desk stands in one corner, with a large blood-red tapestry hanging behind it.  The walls are lined in bookshelves, each one bearing a full load of ancient books written in spidery, otherworldly scripts. Doors stand to the east and west.

rooms.name: The High Priest of Blackmourne's Chambers
rooms.description: You are standing in the private chambers of Ruin Wormheart, High Priest of Blackmourne.  On the walls, you can see the symbol of Blackmourne, surrounded by candles and signs that make the soul shiver.  The chamber is simple, although there is an open closet with various implements of torture in it.

rooms.name: Acolytes' Chamber
rooms.description: This austere chamber's stone walls are painted black with blood-red streaks, the colors of Blackmourne, and spartanly furnished with beds that look fairly comfortable. Symbols and trappings of Blackmourne adorn the walls all over, and a red carpet muffles footsteps. The only exit lies to the north.

rooms.name: Acolyte's Chamber
rooms.description: You are standing in a chamber dedicated to the servants of the temple. All around you can see trappings and symbols of Blackmourne...

rooms.name: Assassin's Hall
rooms.description: This wide hallway is made of dark stone, with a carpet on the floor. The walls are adorned with tapestries depicting the symbols of the Order of Assassins. The hallway runs to the east and west, with a room lying northward where one may hone one's skills and study.

rooms.name: Assassin's Hall
rooms.description: This wide hallway is made of dark stone, with tapestries on it depicting the symbols of the Order of Assassins. It ends here, with a barracks to the south for assassins to rest in.

rooms.name: Assassin's Barracks
rooms.description: This little chamber looks comfortably appointed, with comfortable beds and soft carpeting on the floor. Trophies hang above each bed -- always the preserved, severed hand of a victim. The only exit lies to the north.

rooms.name: A Study Hall
rooms.description: A spacious chamber, this room is spartan in nature, and is furnished with couches and desks where one may sit and study or plot. A sparring pit in one corner seems well-designed for improving one's skills. The only exit lies to the south.

rooms.name: Beneath the Sacrifical Altar of Blackmourne
rooms.description: You are in a small chamber beneath the sacrifical altar. Shelves line the walls along with many strange books and items for the Black Rites.

Up.description: Looking up, you see the underside of an altar. Perhaps you can open the trapdoor.

extras.text: The shelves are lined with many books and ceremonial trappings. There is a chest on one of the shelves.
The chest is slightly open. You can see a gleam from inside.

rooms.name: Kathra's Maps
rooms.description: The room is probably well organized and full of maps and the like but you cannot concentrate on anything but the glorious beauty of the shop owner standing in the corner reading something you couldn't care less about.

rooms.name: A Very Dark Alley
rooms.description: This is end of an alley.  There is a putrid smell, like rotting refuse and wasted food.  The walls of the alley are high and encourage continual shadow, no matter the time of day.  The alley continues off to the north, back towards a more lighted area.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Bard Union Office
rooms.description: The throng of the crowd coming and going from the Red Feathered Nest obscures the small side door that serves as the entrance to the Bard Union Office, one of the most important organizations in the Bard Guild.

rooms.name: The Bard Union Office
rooms.description: For one of the most important organizations for free-spirited artists, the union head office is a shocking homage to bureaucracy.  Bards of all types come here to look for jobs, swap stories from the road, get the goss on other artists, pay their guild taxes, and collect their pensions, among other things. The walls and tables are covered with audition notices and job openings. Copies of the Union Handbook, stating all the rules, regulations, and contract terms for entertainment contracts are available here as well.
